Welcome to Distributed_Malaria_Detection’s documentation!¶

src.dataloader.create_dataloaders(batchsize=28, img_size=28, path='../data/Classification', random_background=False, num_workers=0, percentage_of_dataset=array([0.75, 0.2 , 0.05]), balance=array([[0.5, 0.5], [0.5, 0.5], [0.5, 0.5]]))¶

  • path –

  • num_workers –

Returns

src.dataloader.create_dataset(path, data_augmentation)¶

Convenience function for this project :param path: str path to root directory containing folders with samples for each class :param data_augmentation: torch transforms object :return: torch dataset

src.dataloader.get_data_augmentation(random_background, img_size, dark_background=True)¶

Standard composed transformations for data augmentation :param random_background: Bool - Randomize background :param img_size: Scales input images to square img_size :param dark_background: Bool - True - background has val 0 otherwise val 255 :return:

src.dataloader.get_labels_and_class_counts(labels_list)¶

Calculates the counts of all unique classes. :param labels_list: list or ndarray with labels :return:

src.dataloader.randomize_background(x, dark_background=True)¶

Since images in the malaria datasets have default backgrounds around the cells and LIME indicates that NNs use the backgrounds shape to make predictions :param x: torch.tensor :param dark_background: Bool value of background True - 0,False - 255 :return: Image with ranomized input

src.dataloader.resample(target_list, imbal_class_prop)¶

Function adapted from ptrblck’s PyTorch fork https://github.com/ptrblck/tutorials/blob/imbalanced_tutorial/intermediate_source/imbalanced_data_tutorial.py#L297 Resample the indices to create an artificially imbalanced dataset. :param target_list :param imbal_class_prop :return:

src.dataloader.set_prop_dataset(datasets, targets, balance)¶

Creates datasets with a given balance of classes :param datasets: :param targets: :param balance: :return:

src.dataloader.split_dataset(dataset, percentage_of_dataset)¶

Seperate dataset into parts with percentages specified in percentage_of_dataset :param dataset: torch Dataset to be split :param percentage_of_dataset: list or numpy array with percentage of each split :return: torch subsets
